page.title: 02FARMWAYS.
page.content:
Farmways is situated in G.R.205165. It is a{farming business co-operative.}It originated on a greenfield site, built with the aid of E.E.C. and government grants. During its development there were problems with planning permission; these were overcome as it is an agricultural business and this was the most convenient site. The reason for this positioning was to give greatest accessibility from local farms. It opened as Farmways in 1951, but was previously owned by Teesside Farmers, another agricultural business. It acts as a{grain store}for local farmers, and it also produces{animal feed.}It employs forty people, with two employees housed on site.
GRAIN STORAGE AND DRYER. The grain store has a capacity of
